title: Sanjun Gu Grafting Farmers Forum Presentation 2012

tasks.task: Attend a farmers forum discussing grafting techniques for tomatoes and other vegetables.
subtasks: Sit in the audience for the presentation.
Pay attention to the introductory slides or handouts.
Note the presenter's background (Dr. Sanjun Gu from Lincoln University).
Understand the reasons for researching tomato grafting (disease resistance, enhanced vigor, season extension).
Learn about the grafting process using tubing method.
Observe and note the survival rates of heirloom tomato grafting trials (Beaufort and Maxifort rootstocks).
Understand the field试验结果, showing good survival rates without significant incompatibility issues.
Note the impact of different high tunnel poly layers (single vs. double) on grafted heirloom tomato yields under heat stress.
Consider the implications of the research for farmers looking to implement grafting techniques.

tasks.task: Participate in Q&A following the presentation.
subtasks: Ask about cucumber and watermelon research related to grafting.
Seek recommendations for additional resources on vegetable grafting.
Thank the presenter and appreciate the information provided.
Reflect on future applications of grafting in personal/farm practices.
